The Head of School is charged with the comprehensive responsibility for all activities involving students and faculty at the school site. The Head of School hires, trains, mentors and develops the faculty that provides outstanding classroom instruction leading to high achieving successful students. The Head of School is accountable for building a vibrant, engaged and satisfied parent and student community, and in meeting annual student enrollment and retention goals.Job ResponsibilitiesActs as the educational leader of the school, responsible for its day to day academic operation, its culture and sense of community and is responsible for maintaining the enrollment of the schoolDirects the activities of the facultyServes as Chief Articulator of the mission and goals of BASIS.ed Independent for faculty, parents and students, and leads the execution of regular formal communications in this capacity.Observes, supervise and evaluates faculty in the development and implementation of curriculumEnsures an environment in which learning can take place through a school climate that is supportive and high moraleWorks collaboratively and proactively with the admissions team by participating in informational meetings, personal family meetings, and select community events to ensure that the school meets annual recruitment goalsOversees the activities of the school directors and meets regularly with them to assess student performanceEnsures compliance with all legal requirements of government regulations and agenciesEstablishes programs for the orientation of new facultyConducts regular meetings with faculty Manages the processes necessary for the development of the master school schedule; assigns teachers and students to classes and other obligationsServes as a consultant to teachers in matters of classroom management, teaching methods and school proceduresOversees academic guidance, grading and standards for student assessment
